subject: Data
title: Beneficial Ownership Registries: Exposing Hidden Money
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Beneficial Ownership Registries: Exposing Hidden Money.

hook.text: Shell companies hide who really owns them. Open registries are pulling back the curtain on dirty money.

buildup.text: Beneficial ownership registries require companies to disclose their true human owners â€” not just nominee directors.

discovery.text: The UK's open register, launched in 2016, was the first in the world to make ownership data publicly searchable.

twist.text: Criminals adapted quickly: using countries without registries as new hiding spots, creating a global patchwork.

climax.text: The EU now requires all member states to maintain beneficial ownership registries, closing European loopholes.

punchline.text: When ownership is hidden, corruption thrives. Open registries end the secrecy.

quiz.question: Which country first created a public beneficial ownership registry?
